file_content.text: You almost done here? Sooner I can get off Kaon, the better.
I'm not trying to be pushy or anything, but I'm ready to leave whenever you are.
About time the cavalry showed up. Been hiding out here in the spaceport for days. Name's Melarra.
You're probably going to check the records and see it was my ship that brought the rakghouls here. But it wasn't my fault!
I had no idea those things were in my cargo hold. I'm as much a victim as anyone.
Don't you feel bad about all the suffering you caused? Did you even try to help?
You don't sound very sorry.
Helping others is your thing, Jedi, not mine. Besides, this wasn't my fault. Blame the man who hired me.
The fact that you survived when everyone else died suggests you were anticipating something like this.
You had to suspect something.
Not like this. But I admit my guard was up. Always a good idea when you're working for someone who carries a grudge.
Only an idiot would take a commission without knowing what she's carrying.
Not much of a pilot, then.
Times are tough. I take whatever work I can get, and the man who hired me doesn't like questions.
You have some secret strategy for dealing with the rakghouls?
I'm impressed you survived.
Find a good place to hide while they're chomping on someone else. You want more than that, ask the man who hired me.
Your actions resulted in millions of deaths! Why shouldn't I execute you on the spot?
I should kill you right now!
Kill me and you'll never know what happened here. So simmer down and listen to my side of the story.
I won't judge you without giving you a chance to explain.
Okay, I'm listening....
You heard of Doctor Lorrick? He's a member of the Thirty-seven Families from Deservo. Bitter rivals of the Tion ruling family.
Lorrick instructed me to fly to Kaon. Rakghouls burst out of my cargo hold the second I touched down. Blood and bodies everywhere.
You were still inside your shuttle. You could have just taken off when the attack began.
Why didn't you fly away?
Figured Lorrick was expecting that. Thought he might have booby-trapped the shuttle. So I slipped out and hid in the spaceport.
Kaon isn't the only planet to be overrun by this plague. Did you land anywhere else first?
Other worlds were infected.
I wasn't the only pilot he hired. He sent a bunch of us out. Probably figured none of us would make it back.
Most rakghouls are little more than beasts. This plan required patience and timing.
Rakghouls aren't that smart.
They didn't attack like wild animals. Seemed like they had a plan. Like they were following orders... and searching for me!
The last thing Lorrick wanted was for me to survive. Because I can tell you where to find him.
You're going to help me stop him to make amends for your role in this tragedy.
So you do feel guilty.
What? No! This is about revenge. Lorrick double-crossed me.
How much is this info going to cost me?
In exchange for what?
Not a thing. Look, I'm in trouble here. I figure if I come clean, maybe I can earn some goodwill.
Give me his location.
Where is he?
The shuttle departed from a remote island on Ord Mantell. Lorrick has a secret base there. But that's all I know.
Look, I came clean. Told you what I know in good faith. So you going to get me out of here now, or what?
You were nothing but a pawn in Lorrick's scheme. And you did provide valuable information.
I guess we can help you.
Glad we're on the same page. Tell you what--just drop me off at the nearest uninfected planet, and I'll figure it out from there.
We have to verify you're not carrying the plague, first. A shuttle will pick you up when I'm done here and take you for testing.
What if you're infected?
Great. Poked and prodded by medical droids. Beats the alternative, I guess.
Republic SIS needs to know everything you can tell them about Doctor Lorrick. A shuttle will pick you up when I'm done here.
We still need to question you.
Republic custody, huh? Guess it's better than the alternative.
I'll send a shuttle to pick you up when I'm done here.
Deal.
Just do me a favor--don't wait too long to come and get me. I've spent more than enough time on this rock.
You knew Lorrick was dangerous when you agreed to work for him. Now millions are dead. Their blood is on your hands.
You deserve death. [Kill her]
But I didn't... I was just... no!
Hold on, hold on, hold on. Don't shoot. Not a rakghoul. Just a harmless shuttle pilot. Name's Melarra.
Look, I need to get off this world. And I know how this whole rakghoul outbreak started. So maybe we can swing a deal?
Only a fool tries to bargain with the Emperor's Wrath.
You're playing a deadly game.
Bargain? Who said anything about a bargain? My info's a gift! A gift to show my deep and sincere respect.
It's easy to make promises. Even easier to break them.
You're far too trusting.
Yeah, I know how that goes. But I'm out of options here. I gotta trust you, or I'm done.
I don't make deals. I make corpses. Understand?
Tell me or you die.
Oh. Okay. New plan: I tell you everything I know and nobody gets hurt. Especially me.
Either give me the info now, or I set up a little session with the Imperial interrogators.
We can force you to talk.
Interrogators? What? No. We don't need them. I'll just tell you what I know. Friend to friend, right?
Tell me what you know, and I'll make sure you get off of Kaon.
Okay.
Good. Okay. Yeah. I knew we could work this out. We're all reasonable folk.
I already had one person I met on this world turn into a rakghoul right in front of me.
Are you infected?
N-n-n-n-no way. I'm clean. So don't get all nervous and take me out if I sneeze, okay? Just listen to what I have to say.
So, uh... these rakghouls? Yeah. I brought them. On my shuttle. But I didn't know what I was doing!
I'm just a pilot. I was hired to fly here. My boss is the one you want, not me!
Why didn't the rakghouls kill you along with everybody else? Do you have some kind of protection?
How did you survive?
Just better at hiding, I guess. Boss probably figured the rakghouls would get me, too.
You're basically responsible for millions of deaths. Doesn't that bother you?
You don't seem too upset.
Sure. I mean, better them than me. But it's not like I'm a monster. My boss, on the other hand....
Your boss's name. Now.
Who do you work for?
You heard of Doctor Lorrick? He's a member of the Thirty-seven families, the main political rivals of the royal family.
Hired me to make a delivery to Kaon. Soon as I touched down, the rakghouls came pouring out. It was ugly.
You were still inside your shuttle. Why didn't you just take off?
Why didn't you fly away?
Pretty obvious Lorrick wanted me dead. Figured he booby-trapped the shuttle, so I jumped out of the cockpit and hid.
The rakghouls waited patiently until you landed. Doctor Lorrick must have found a way to make them follow orders.
Those rakghouls were trained.
You could be right. They weren't acting like mindless beasts during the attack. Seemed like they had a purpose.
Doctor Lorrick obviously didn't want anyone to survive the attack. He's trying to cover his tracks.
You're lucky to be alive.
Too bad for him I got a heightened survival sense.
Lorrick double-crossed me. Now I get to return the favor. He's hiding out at a secret base on Ord Mantell.
So, uh... that's about all I know. Now, you ready to get me off this rock?
You've outlived your usefulness.
I'd rather you die. [Kill her]
But I told you everything I--ah. Now I see the problem. Damn.
Your information was quite valuable.
You've earned it.
Glad we're on the same page. Tell you what--just drop me off at the nearest uninfected planet, and I'll figure it out from there.
We have to verify you're not carrying the plague, first. A shuttle will pick you up when I'm done here and take you for testing.
What if you're infected?
Great. Poked and prodded by medical droids.
Guess it's better than being left here with the rakghouls.
The Empire needs to know everything you can tell them about Doctor Lorrick. A shuttle will pick you up when I'm done here.
We still need to question you.
Didn't realize an Imperial interrogation was part of the deal. Guess I'll have to tell my story again, huh?
Just--tell them to go easy on me. I've already told you everything I know.
And make sure they let me go when they're done. I don't want to "disappear," if you catch my drift.
I'll send a shuttle to pick you up when I'm done here.
Deal.
Okay. Great. Wasn't sure you'd keep up your end of the deal.
Good to know the Empire can be trusted. I'll keep that in mind if I'm ever looking for work.
